title: RC circuits - currents in resistors Z A and X

content.question:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

A circuit has a battery and three resistors, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The battery and resistance values are as follows.

The battery has <math alttext="e m f open E equals 6.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has resistance <math alttext="R sub X equals 12 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has resistance <math alttext="R sub Y equals 36 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> has resistance <math alttext="R sub Z equals 12 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>.

(a)

i. Calculate a value for the current in Resistor <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>.

frqParts.text:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

A circuit has a battery and three resistors, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The battery and resistance values are as follows.

The battery has <math alttext="e m f open E equals 6.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has resistance <math alttext="R sub X equals 12 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has resistance <math alttext="R sub Y equals 36 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> has resistance <math alttext="R sub Z equals 12 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>.

(a)

i. Calculate a value for the current in Resistor <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>.

The same circuit is shown again in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, with the labeled positions <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>, <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math>, <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math>, <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, <math alttext="e" overflow="scroll"><mi>e</mi></math>, <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math>, <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"> <mi>h</mi> </math> indicated at various points in the circuit.

ii. On the axes in Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, sketch a graph of the electric potential as a function of position along the circuit path <math alttext="a b c d e f g h a" overflow="scroll"><mi>abcdefgha</mi></math>.

Next, the circuit is modified as shown in Figure <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math>. The same battery and Resistor <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> are part of the new circuit, in addition to an initially-open switch, two resistors <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and two capacitors with the same capacitance <math alttext="C sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The resistors have the same resistance <math alttext="R sub A equals R sub B, which equals 6.0 ohms" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>, and the two capacitors have no initial charge.

(b) The switch is closed. Consider resistors <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. For each of the following times, indicate how the current <math alttext="I sub A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> in Resistor <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> compares to the current <math alttext="I sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> in Resistor <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. If either current is zero at either of the indicated times, be sure to indicate that as well.

i. Immediately after the switch is closed (select ALL that apply):

_____<math alttext="I sub A is greater than I sub X" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="I sub A equals I sub X" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.42em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="I sub A is less than I sub X" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>

_____<math alttext="I sub A equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="I sub X equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

ii. A long time after the switch is closed (select ALL that apply):

_____<math alttext="I sub A is greater than I sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="I sub A equals I sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="I sub A is less than I sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>

_____<math alttext="I sub A equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="I sub X equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
Justify your selections for parts (b)(i) and (b)(ii).

skill.text: 1.A: Create diagrams, tables, charts, or schematics to represent physical situations.
